question: FYI – here’s a little twist: A robe takes 3 bolts of blue fiber and half that much white fiber. How many bolts in total does it take? Let’s do the math carefully.
By the way, here’s something interesting! John takes care of 12 dogs, each needing 0.75 hours a day. How many hours a week does he spend taking care of dogs? Think it through!

Quick note before we jump in: Dana can run five times faster than she walks, and skip at half her running speed. If skipping speed is 4 mph, how many miles can she cover in eight hours, spending one-third running and two-thirds walking?
Just a heads-up: Raymond does two-thirds as much laundry as Sarah, who does 3 times David’s amount. If Sarah does 300 pounds, what’s the difference between Raymond and David’s loads?
Friendly reminder! Dan plants 4 rose bushes, each with 30 roses, and each rose has 9 thorns. How many thorns total?
Quick heads-up: Greg’s alarm rings 5 times first, 2x longer second, and half that third. How many total rings?
FYI – here’s a fun one: John buys 3 pairs of shoes per child for 4 kids; each pair costs $70. What’s the total spent?
By the way, Tom gets 5 car washes a month at $18 each. How much does he pay in a year?
Quick note before we continue: Jordan plays games 3 hours/day. If he worked those hours at $12/hour, how much would he make in a week?
Heads-up! Carl buys 8 packs of cookies (7 each) at $0.15 per cookie. How much change from a $15 bill?
FYI – Juan and Carlos make lemonade: $4 lemons, $3 sugar per gallon; 24 glasses/gallon at $0.60 each. If profit is $40, how much did they spend on lemons?
Just to note: Lloyd tutors at $12/hour, 6 hours week one, 9 hours week two. Total earnings for two weeks?
By the way, Jenna picked two-thirds the apples her mom did. If mom picked 30, how many did they pick together?
Reminder! Neighbors prank Sue: 20 flamingos Friday, half painted white Saturday, +20 pink Sunday. At noon Sunday, how many more pink than white flamingos?
FYI – Carlos rents a canoe at $35/hour for 4 hours; Benji rents a raft at $20/hour for 6 hours. What’s the combined rental cost?
Quick heads-up: John orders pizza for 25 friends, 3 slices each; pizzas have 10 slices. How many pizzas needed?
Just to note: A chef buys 5 onion bags at 60 pounds each; onions cost $1.80/pound. Total spent?
FYI – here’s a little twist: Bill starts on the 5th floor. He rides the elevator up to the floor that’s equal to 3 times his starting floor plus 9. What floor is Bill on now?
By the way, here’s something fun! A juggler can handle 20 balls. Half are tennis balls, and half of the tennis balls are red. How many red tennis balls are there?

Quick note before we jump in: 5 adults and 10 children share 10 packets of chocolate bars. Each packet holds 6 bars. If each adult gets 7 bars and the rest are divided among the kids, how many does each child get?
Just a heads-up: Will buys 18 oranges. He asks his 2 sons to wash as many as their ages: the oldest is 10, the youngest is half that. How many oranges remain unwashed?
Friendly reminder! Annika brought $60 to the fair. She spent half on food, plus $15 on rides. How much money does she have left?
Quick heads-up: A magazine costs half the price of a book. The book costs $6. A pen costs $2 less than a magazine. How much is the pen?
FYI – here’s a fun one: Luke eats 3 hot dogs. Thomas eats three times more. John eats half of Thomas’s amount. How many more hot dogs does John eat than Luke?
By the way, an eraser costs $3 and a pencil costs $4. How much do 5 erasers and 7 pencils cost together?

Quick note before we continue: At the carnival, David buys a ride bracelet for $35 (unlimited rides), while Dasha buys tickets at $3 each for 10 rides. How much money does David save compared to Dasha?
Heads-up! Jenny slices a pizza into 16 pieces. She gives 1/4 to Bill, 1/3 to Mark, and eats 3 herself. How many slices remain?
FYI – Rozanne is making eggnog: she uses 5 dozen eggs from cases plus 4 loose eggs. Each tray holds 6 glasses, and each glass needs 4 eggs. How many trays can she fill?
Just to note: Ali had $30. Leila gave him half of her $120. How much money does Ali have now?
By the way, Mary has 8 jars of sprinkles, each decorates 10 cupcakes. If each baking tray holds 15 cupcakes, how many trays does she need to use all the sprinkles?
Reminder! Stetson bets Alec he’ll give $12 for each apple he eats. At the orchard, he eats 3/5 of the 50 apples they picked. How much money does Stetson give up?
FYI – here’s a little twist: Jana has 36 puppies. Three-fourths of them are Pomeranians, and half of those are girls. How many girl Pomeranians does Jana have?
By the way, here’s something interesting! Joe throws 30 punches per minute. A match lasts 6 rounds of 4 minutes each. How many punches did he throw?
Quick note before we jump in: Kelsie bakes three times more cookies than Josh, who makes one-fifth the number Suzanne makes. If Suzanne makes 40 cookies, how many does Kelsie make?
Just a heads-up: Timothy's locker is 32 cubic inches. Zack’s locker is half that, and Peter's is one-third of Zack’s. What’s Peter’s locker volume in cubic inches?
Friendly reminder! Cody and Trevor share 16 sandwiches. Cody eats a quarter, Trevor eats a fifth. How many sandwiches remain?
Quick heads-up: Jerry is twice as old as he was 6 years ago. How old will he be in 4 years?
FYI – here’s a fun one: John builds a program with $120,000 funding for the first 6 months. Research extends to 12 times longer, and each later month costs 60% more. What’s the total research cost?
By the way, in the jeweler’s shop, a gold piece costs 3/4 of a diamond piece. Silver is $500 less than gold. If a diamond piece is $2400, what’s the total price for all three?
Quick note before we continue: Sally’s bank account started at $250, now shows $510. Her weekly wage should be $350. How many dollars were withheld?
Heads-up! A pound of almonds costs $12, walnuts $18. How much more does 2/3 pound almonds + 1/2 pound walnuts cost than 1/4 pound almonds + 1/2 pound walnuts?
FYI – on a basketball court, 200 teachers stand; 55% are history teachers. The rest are math teachers. Each sleeps 7 hours daily. How many total sleep hours for all math teachers per day?
Just to note: Gissela's truck hauls 5,000 pounds. Gordy’s hauls 1,000 pounds more. Combined with Gary, they haul 14,500 pounds. How much can Gary’s truck carry?
By the way, Alex tutors over 8 days and charges $15 per day. How much does Alex earn in total?
FYI – here’s a little twist: A pencil costs $0.60, and an eraser costs $0.30. If you buy 7 pencils and 9 erasers and pay $15, how much change would you get?

By the way, here’s something interesting! Castle bought 5 boxes of Choco Crunch and 6 boxes of Honey Loops this week. Last week she bought 3 boxes. How many more boxes did she buy this week compared to last week?
Quick note before we jump in: Jeremy saw 15 birds in the backyard and scared away 1/5 of them. A few minutes later, 25 more birds joined. How many birds are now in the backyard?
Just a heads-up: Marissa bought a toy at the store for $25. She had $100 and used the rest to buy Jimmy candy bars at $6 each. How many candy bars did Marissa buy?
Friendly reminder! Anthony had 60 pencils. He gave away half to Brandon and 2/3 of the rest to Charlie. How many pencils did Anthony keep?
Quick heads-up: Jack visits a museum 200 miles away, driving 80 mph each way. He spends 5 hours at the museum. How long is he gone in total?
FYI – here’s a fun one: Samwell’s store sells 48 TVs: 1/3 smart TVs, 1/6 analog TVs, rest OLED. How many OLED TVs did they sell?
By the way, Damien collects 15 bottle caps a day, each worth $0.30. How much does he earn in a 31-day month?
Quick note before we continue: Kris wants a 40-hour game achievement. She plays 1 hour daily for 10 days, then 3 hours daily for 5 days. How many more hours does she need?
Heads-up! John buys 4 goats at $550 each and 3 cows at $1600 each. How much does he spend in total?
FYI – An electronics seller buys 6 phones at $750 each and pays $5000 in cash. How much change will the seller return?
Just to note: Martin weighs 60 kg. Carl weighs 18 kg more, and Christian weighs 10 kg more than Carl. Harry weighs 7 kg less than Christian. What’s Harry’s weight?
By the way, Dijana rows 60 miles; Anis rows 1/4 more. What’s the total distance they rowed together that day?
Reminder! Dean has 40 marbles. He gives 1/4 to Jamie and 12 to Donald. How many does he keep?
FYI – 25 students each sell lollipops costing $0.90, averaging 12 sold each. If they bought them at $0.6 each, how much profit did the class raise?
FYI – Shawna's father is six times as old as Shawna. Shawna is currently four times as old as Aliya. If Aliya is 4 years old, how old is Shawna's father?
Quick note! Pamela applies an ounce of sunscreen every hour she's outside. Her bottle holds 10 ounces. While on vacation, she’ll be outside 5 hours daily for 7 days. How many bottles will she need?
By the way, Edgar eats 20 pretzels daily. If his brother eats half that, how many pretzels does his brother eat in 8 days?

Friendly reminder! Bethany can run 12 laps per hour. Trey runs 5 more laps than Bethany. Shaelyn runs half as many as Trey, and Quinn runs 3 fewer than Shaelyn. How many more laps can Bethany run compared to Quinn?
Heads-up! There are 60 books in a small library. Half are in English, 20% in German. How many are Spanish books?
FYI – An apple orchard sells apples in bags of 12. They sold 2400 apples today. How much did they earn if each bag is $6?
Quick note! Jeff is 12 years older than Martha. Martha is 5 years younger than Mike, who is 26. How old is Jeff?
By the way, Caroline is four times older than Ben. Ben is three times older than Chris. If Chris is 5, how old is Caroline?
Reminder! Last year, 60 students enrolled in the art class. This year, enrollment increased by 25%. How many students are enrolled this year?
FYI – Carl has a cane half as tall as himself. Carl is two feet taller than Ned, who is three feet shorter than Isabel. If Isabel is 8 feet tall, how long is Carl’s cane?
Quick heads-up! Jack had $120. Sophia gave him 1/4 of her $160. How much money does Jack have now?
By the way, Sam ran 4 miles on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday; 6 miles on Tuesday and Thursday. How many miles did Sam run this week?
Reminder! Ali teaches one class of 140 students at a private school. John teaches two classes, each 1/7 the size of Ali’s. What’s the combined capacity?
FYI – John, the carpenter, made 5 wooden chairs for $25 each and 3 tables for $50 each. How much does Ali owe John?
Quick note! Carly makes two fewer than four times as many brownies as cupcakes. If five people each get two treats, how many cupcakes did Carly make?
By the way, James wants to hang streamers around his rectangular backyard, which is 25 feet long and 18 feet wide. How many feet of streamers does he need?
